sentences.en: A modest man will never boast of his merits.
sentences.cn: 谦虚的人决不夸自己的功劳.

sentences.en: Don't you and Fitchett boast too much, that is all!
sentences.cn: 你和菲奇特就算了, 别不知好歹!

sentences.en: Henry actually used to boast that he never kept any files.
sentences.cn: 事实上享利经常吹嘘他不保留任何档案.

sentences.en: His boast that he could drink ten pints of beer impressed nobody.
sentences.cn: 他自吹自擂说能喝十品脱啤酒,但无人理睬他.

sentences.en: His statement isn't merely an idle boast.
sentences.cn: 他的话不仅仅是虚张声势的自夸。

sentences.en: However , it was my only experience to boast about in my childhood.
sentences.cn: 在我的童年中, 也就只有过这么一次.

sentences.en: I don't want to boast, but I can actually speak six languages.
sentences.cn: 不是我吹嘘，我确实能讲六种语言。

sentences.en: In its heyday, the studio's boast was that it had more stars than there are in heaven.
sentences.cn: 在其全盛时期，该制片公司夸口说，他们旗下的明星比天上的星星还要多。

sentences.en: It is his boast that he has never been late for work.
sentences.cn: 他为自己上班从未迟到过感到自豪.

sentences.en: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.cn: 该慈善机构从未将任何人拒之门外,并引以为豪.

sentences.en: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.cn: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.en: The fishing boast rested on the bay under their white sails.
sentences.cn: 扬着白帆的渔船停在海湾上.

sentences.en: The houses will boast the latest energy-saving technology.
sentences.cn: 这些房屋将应用最新的节能技术。
这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.en: We must never brag and boast.
We remember our mother's stern instructions not to boast.
sentences.cn: 我们谨记母亲不许我们在人前炫耀的严厉教诲。

words.tran_cn: 自夸的；自负的；喜夸耀的
自夸的人；大言不惭的人；吹牛者
自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物

trans.tran_en: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good
